lines.text: Boy you're touchy.
He's got hemorrhoids, Franklin.
You got 'roids?
Oh, I ate mud once. Tasted okay. But they had to take me to the hospital and pump my stomach and I met a guy with a monkey heart!
I'm not crazy.
I didn't say you were.
I was tested, ya know.
Well then you obviously cheated.
He was a very annoying man.
The gun man?
No, the gun man was very polite.
What are you doing?
Driving into the back of a truck, Dan, you ever watch the A-Team?
We could use a nut like you down at the carnival. Ever bite the head off a chicken?
Not lately.
Where are your donuts?
Sir, we're a gourmet market.
Okay, where are your gourmet donuts?
What adorable children.
You want'em? 'Cause I'll sell them to you real cheap.
We've got a ferris wheel, tilt-a-whirl, bumper cars.
I like bumper cars.
Actually it's bumper *car*, the bank repossessed the rest of them.

[about the ferris wheel]
I'm not getting on that death trap.
Oh we won that law suit.
Huh?
Okay we tied, but it's still safe. Come on, I'll show you how to operate it. It's so easy a trained monkey could do it and it did until that uproar with the Humane Society.

[noticing a woman getting her lips waxed]
That's amazing. I'd never have to shave Mom's hump again. Um, that is, she's got a hump on the back of her neck.
Can't one of the neighbors drive the carpool? What about Mr. Kopek?
He's 88.
So he'll drive real slow.
He's had three strokes.
But never while driving.

[a jelly filled danish got rubbed on his shirt]
Great! Raspberry glaze!
Soak it in cold water.
Thank you very much, ma'am, and by the way, someone your age should be a little more careful with a hand gun.
Bite me.
Listen, cutie pie when they reposess the truck, you won't have to leave them any gas.
Right, you're the expert on gas, Mom.
Uh oh. I dropped my wallet. I can't drive without a driver's license, you'll have to switch with me.
I don't think that rule applies when committing a felony.
Oh, right.

Listen, Dan, I'm not a perfect person. I see a buck on the ground, I pick it up. Sometimes I take more than 10 items right through the express lane, and I have a temper, like my neighbor plays his music too loud. So I killed him, I cut him up and I put him in my freezer. I'm just kidding! Just breaking the tension!
I'd say you picked the wrong store to rob this time, pal.
Excuse me, Lieutenant but I am not robbing this store.
Yeah right, I suppose that's a bag of donuts you got there right?
They don't even serve donuts here, you should know that, you're a cop.
[They are listening to a heavy metal song]
Great tape. This yours?
Oh yeah, I got everything by the Screaming Idiots.
This is the Ramones, actually, I haven't heard the Idiots yet, maybe you can turn me on to them.
We've come to give you back our pay checks.
Aw you didn't have to do that.
Sure we did. They bounced. Listen, Franklin, you've been very good to us, but we've gotten an offer from Wingling Brothers.
*THE* Ringling Brothers?
No, *WINGLING* Brothers!
[Andrew got an F on his spelling test]
Mrs. Karkanie is giving me a do over. She says everyone get's a second chance.
That's only because she's been married 5 times. Let me tell you something, sport, in the business world there are no second chances.
in their van which is inside a refrigeration truck]
It's freezing.
Huddle together if you're cold, I'll turn on the heat.
That's brilliant. See in order to get heat you have to turn on the engine, thereby trapping the fumes and rendering us all dead by asphixiation.
In that case forget the heat. Hey who farted? Did you cut the cheese, Dan?
For God's sake, no I did not.
How about you, Kayla?
Girls don't fart.
Really? Come over to my house sometime and ask my mom why all our cats committed suicide.
Hey there, Dan, you're late.
Well I didn't take our usual shortcut through the mall.

[on his way to the bank, contemplating his robbery plan]
This will go smooth. Unless they shoot me, which they won't because I'm gonna draw first. Of course they could push that button under the counter, but I know it's gonna be fine.
[Parks and approaches bank. The doors are locked and standing inside is a guard]
Oh hey, buddy, I need you to open a safe for me. I mean an account, a safe account. But I see you're not open right now so I'll go grab a cup of coffee and come back later.
Believe me, Hammerman's is better than mud.
Is that gonna be your new Hammerman's slogan, Dad?
[Daniel races for the phone. Franklin stops him]
No calls! That is, no obscene calls. He's trying to quit.
I am not.
Well you should! What's your phone number?
Very funny. Do realize if I get arrested you won't make your meeting because you'll be filling out police reports until next October.
Look, Mr. Kopek's working in his yard.
Yeah. Let this be a lesson to you kids, the world says that he's too old to drive a car but look at him, he's a vibrant, healthy old man who can do anything he put's his mind to.
Dad, Mr. Kopek's not wearing his pants.
Yeah so from now on you kids stay away from him okay?
[Kayla slaps Bucky]
BUCKY!
What? I thought you were scared, so I grabbed you shoulder.
That *wasn't* my *shoulder*.
I want to be the hostage!
How come I never get to be the hostage?
That's because you're a girl.
Hey, girls can be hostages, too. I mean, we're moving toward the twenty-first century and girls can be whatever they want.
Right on, sister.
Ok, quiet down or nobody gets to be the hostage!
Well, that made sense, dad.
I refuse to die in a polyester smock.
